section.title: Introduction
section.p: The design and implementation of DingsBums?! has been a one man show until now. There are good reasons, why this should change in the future:

ul.li: I only have so much time. I work on DingsBums?! in my spare time.
While I use the application myself, I am not aware of all the features and usage patterns, that real users require. The development of DingsBums?! should be driven what real users need and request.
My knowledge of foreign languages is limited when it comes to translations of the graphical user interface and the documentation.

section.title: Where you can help
section.p: The DingsBums?! project is an Open Source volunteer project released under a very liberal license. There are lots of areas, where DingsBums?! would profit from your help, and where no knowledge of programming is needed: e.g. documenting, proposing ideas, reporting bugs, suggesting bug-fixes, etc ..

ul.li: Accessibility: is the (graphical) user interface usable for people with disabilities?

End user distribution: If you happen to have an Apple Macintosh with a recent version of the operating system, you could provide other Mac users with a Mac OS X Application Bundle for easier installation and execution.
Check need for languages in Middle East (Arabic, Hebrew) and Asia (Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Mongolian).
